definition: with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
bone
(bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)
see 碌碡[liu4 zhou5]

sentences.english: He got out of bed with a spring.
sentences.chinese: 他一骨碌爬起跳下了牀。
又好象是一骨碌兒水滴。

definition: to roll rapidly/to spin/Taiwan pr. [gu2 lu5]
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
in a great rush/in a flurry
to quiver
sound of bells etc
to scold/whoosh!
to jump/to bounce/to hop
helter-skelter
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
suddenly
to get up/to leave/to set forth
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
bedside
to take to one's heels/to scram
to walk quietly on tiptoe (idiom)
hurriedly/in haste
